intro: Garuleum pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf garuleum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves that give it its scientific name. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Garuleum pinnatifidum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
